<<<<<<< HEAD
H. His deuises, for his owne exercise, and his friends pleasure Howell, Thomas, fl. 1568-1581.
[104] p.
In Fleetestreate, beneath the conduite, at the signe of the Saint Iohn Euangelist, by [W. How? for] H. Iackson, Imprinted at London : Anno. 1581.
Printer's name suggested by STC. In verse. Dedication signed: Tho. Houell. Running title reads: Delightfull discourses to sundry purposes. First leaf blank; last leaf, M6, missigned M4. Signatures: A⁶ B-L⁴ M⁶. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======
H. His deuises, for his owne exercise, and his friends pleasure Howell, Thomas, fl. 1568-1581.
[104] p.
In Fleetestreate, beneath the conduite, at the signe of the Saint Iohn Euangelist, by [W. How? for] H. Iackson, Imprinted at London : Anno. 1581.
Printer's name suggested by STC. In verse. Dedication signed: Tho. Houell. Running title reads: Delightfull discourses to sundry purposes. First leaf blank; last leaf, M6, missigned M4. Signatures: A⁶ B-L⁴ M⁶. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
] H. Iackson
[W. How?
the signe of the Saint Iohn Euangelist
